comment.author: 11418107@N02
comment._content: Robert F. Wagner (1877-1953), longtime US Senator from New York, served as acting lieutenant governor under Martin H. Glynn in 1913-1914, after the impeachment of William Sulzer. Born in Prussia, immigrated to the US as a boy with his parents. He is perhaps best remembered for introducing the Social Security Act in the Senate, and the "Wagner Act," which created the National Labor Relations Board in 1935. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Robert_F._Wagner His son, Robert F. Wagner Jr., was mayor New York City in the 1950s and 1960s.
